title: A congruence subgroup property for symmetric mapping class groups
abstract:
We prove the congruence subgroup property for the centralizer of a finite
subgroup $G$ in the mapping class group of a hyperbolic oriented and connected
surface of finite topological type $S$ such that the genus of the quotient
surface $S/G$ is at most $2$. As an application, we show that torsion elements
in the mapping class group of a surface of genus $\leq 2$ are conjugacy
distinguished.
